review: Pretty enough art, generic gameplay, the buildup to a mystery is lackluster at best.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.
text_cleaned: pretty enough art, generic gameplay, the buildup to mystery is lackluster at best.

review:
First, I love this game, the story is relaxing and enjoyable. It's atomospheric and at a much slower pace to my other games, could not recommend more.
Now, the negative review is in protest of the developers and how they handled the scandal with pewdiepie which they started. It simply wasn't their place to attack him financially on a topic that the studio wasn't involved in. The original developer who commented on Pewdiepies behaviour has a right to voice their opinion, but to take it to a legal level and affect Pewdiepies revenue, no matter how much Felix makes, was out of line.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

review:
Glad I played it through family share. 
Terribly optimized and a bad story with a cop-out ending.
Overall just another art project walking simulator.
Only good aspects were dialogue, atmosphere, and art style.
Also cannot abide a developer that uses DMCA as a weapon to punish those they deem undesirable.

review:
Basic walking simulator. Starts off with a lot of potential and intrigue, however it eventually devolves into a predictable mess with an inconclusive ending. 
I enjoyed the first half of the game, but the style and stor quickly runs dry. 
Has 0 replay value. Story will not change based on your choices. If you are looking for a fun and inventive indie style game look elsewhere.

review: 20$ on a game that provides you 4-6 hours of gameplay, is a bit to much. the art is spectacular, but story is lacking. If there would be a "butterfly effect", which adds replay value and satisfaction. but given i've played through the game once and done with the game i feel 20$ is well overpriced.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

review:
Overrated game that tries to lengthen itself with endless walking. 
Also, one of the worst developers ever. There is a difference between standing up for what you believe, and then there is overreacting and repeatedly crucifying a public figure for a minor mistake they made that doesn't actually hurt anyone. You want to look like you care about people about liberal ideas? Go attend a anti-Trump protest instead of picking on some YouTube artist with repeated childish Tweets and some DMCA takedown.

review:
Sorry, but this game was pretty boring to be honest. Walk to A, report it to your supervisor, walk to B, report again. Walk, talk, walk, talk. Nothing really comes of it. The twist is not a twist and all three endings aren't really worth replaying.
Well, if I could get refund, I would. 
DO NOT BUY FOR MORE THAN 5€!!!

review: The writing, voice acting and story is interesting for what it is but the game is short, linear and there is no replay value. It's hard for me to call it a game since it's a walking simulator as well. For a walking simulator, there's a ton of backtracking through the same environments. That removes the spectacle of discovering and looking at new locations. While it's visually appealing, you'll be staring at the same places for the entire game. In addition, the choices you make in the game have basically no effect on the story outside a few lines of different dialog.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review:
Way too linear and short.
 Would rather request a refund.
 The game is centered around the plot, but the ending leaves you thinking "Well, that was a whole bunch of nothing."
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ah7LYxysuJ8
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

review:
Leaving a negative review on this shit for two reasons. 
nr 1: the story, in all its simplicity, is way too short. Way too linear and at times. boring. don't get this game for the story. Really. Theres better F2P games with better story out there that don't charge you 30+ bucks for it. 
nr2: Sean Vanaman (one of the devs) is an asshole who thinks he can abuse the law wherever he sees fit. Im not someone who's comfortable with funding a company that hires people like that. 
If i could delete the game from my profile, without even recieving a refund, i would.
Fuck you Sean Vanaman. You piece of shit.

review:
I bought this game a few years back and was really interested in the graphics. But then it all took a turn for the worst when the fire nation attacked. First off, I want to go into detail about the gameplay but that is unfortunatly lacking in this game. I bought it for twenty dollars and beat it in 4 hours which is equivalent to my Minimum Pay at Pizza Hut. I have bought FTL which was only five dollars and played 200 hours which is a much better result of your money. 
Also, The developers are half descended from racoons living under my mothers quadchin. They are overly sensitive, do not know how to write an interesting/unique game, take a joke, and they are Social Justice Warriors thinking they are on a high horse. Extremly Disappointed in both the game and devs.

review: Its not a game but a boring walking simulator with an ugly orange visual tone and zero player choice. Also, its made by an SJW developer that supports censorship so thats something you should consider. Flushing your money down the toilet would be interesting than getting this.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review: I bet you know by now why the negative review... you brought this on yourself by abusing the DMCA system.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review:
Not impressed by the developer. He made an abusive DCMA-claim on Pewdiepie's video as a revenge for one racist word Pewdiepie said on a live stream not related to the lets-play that got copyright striked. 
The DCMA'd video had almost 6 million views on it and probably a huge amount of people bought this game because of it. And now Campo Santo gets free publicity after getting mentioned on every news outlet for the brash stunt, and that's after a year during which they had done nothing to get the video taken down. Just a publicity stunt, would not hold in court.
Will not buy Campo Santo games in the future. And wouldn't recommend this game because it's a stub. Playing it through takes about three hours and it's basically an walking simulator with a dissapointing twist and a crappy ending.

review: It started fine: witty, moody and mysterious. But its absolute linearity, disappointing story and ultimately lack of a solid conclusion leaves a bitter taste in the mouth. Because of the effort, I just wanted to leave it at that. But the developer's recent misuse of Youtube copyright strikes motivates me to warn about how shallow and unsatisfying the game really is. Keep your money.

review:
It's an OK game.  The ending is immensely disappointing.  it's a one time ~5 hour play.  
However, I cannot recommend the game, nor will I support Campo Santo in the future, or anything Sean Vanaman works on again.
People like Sean Vanaman are important for progress and change, but not for the reasons they think.  He is also an excellent example of why you should not use social media to throw temper tantrums, and why you should think before you act.  If you are a man, or an adult in general, observe and learn.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review:
The game is really boring. You walk around and that's pretty much it. They try to throw some corny mystery into it, but it's forced to add excitement to a boring walking simulater. Did nothing to save the game. Poorly written, and poor gameplay.
Also, the dev hates on people and holds grudges even when someone publicly apologizes. He lashes out at people and accuses them of things that are not true, and even uses DCMA as a weapon to silence people more successful than him, no matter how much revenue that person did for them. I suggest you don't purchase this game or support such harmful actions that hurt the gaming and entertainment industry.

review: I remember looking foreward to this game before release, and couldn't wait to jump into it. After playing it I had a mix feeling. I loved the concept, artwork  and the plot. Yet it was too simple, short and limited to really leave a proper impression. Usually I don't care much about dropping a positive or negative review on anything, as I think in the end it's all about an invidual taste, or expectation more than anything. And even if I dislike it I don't feel a need to write it down to critizise as I know what I look for, and what I would reccomend to friends or not. But to cut it to the truth, even tho' I agree that some words isn't really something we would have to accept in this society I know far to well how things can slip out. It doesn't always mean it's something well hidden behind it. In these modern times the biggest problem I see is how literal everyone takes things, even sarcasm and satire is no longer understood, and even if, it is still taken absolutely seriously and out of context just so some people can use it to further their need for attention or case. This is something I find hypocritical, and also against the right of free speech as I can say I am a strong advocate for. Thus I have to combine the reasently "Pewdiepie-issue" with my mediocre experience of this game and leave this here. It's just gone too far.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

review:
Horrible game. Would not recommend even if GameStop was handing out copies for free at the door. Plays like it was developed by blind children of questionable mental capabilities.
You are welcome Sean Vanaham.  Next time learn to not abuse the DMCA features on YouTube like a child.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. review:
First of all, this game is a... what do they call it? JRPG? Probably using the wrong term. It's a walking simulator with a story. Story is pretty darn good, kudos for that. $20? No way Jose! It's simply not worth it, under no circumstances. 
And to top it all off, the developers are now backtracking on their stated policy of Youtube and other online "let's play" recordings just to make a political statement, against the popular Youtuber Pewdiepie. Let me make one thing clear: I despise Pewdiepie. I think he's a blowhard, scumbag, etc. But for a developer to issue a DMCA notice as a form of retaliation for the use of offensive language in a completely different game... Is despicable. And a clear abuse of the DMCA process. I would urge everyone to avoid this game like the plague, as you can't support in good conscious a developer who resorts to this kind of legal abuse. 
Campo Santo, your game isn't great. But what really makes this review negative is your attitude and behavior towards the Let's Play community. Shame!

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

Who's the real villain here? I would not recommend this game because of the game AS WELL as the developer has some kind of self rightious god complex... I think he needs to take a long hard look at himself. I don't think that anyone should say that word but you should take it from within the context and there was no racial hate motivation intended from the word he said, like pewds said he literally wanted to say the worst word, which he did. But I don't believe he wished any malicious hate towards any race when  he said it. People should not say it but a mistake is a mistake, I hope both learn from this. Dev is a... well, i'll let you decide.

Fuck political correctness, Don't buy this game.

review:
Let me start by saying i dont really know s*** about pewdepie or whatever. I dont care about what he has to say or what he does, so this review has nothing to do with all that crap.
This game was fun, i think the only reason i really cant recommend it is that it felt like there was A LOT of hype for it, i wanted the mystery to be something bigger than it was; I am not saying that i disagree with the story which is why i down rate, i am saying you get us hooked on these characters and do NOTHING with them. The build up for the suspense was real, but then the utter fall from the climax of the story was crap! Its like watching LOTR and finding out that the ring didnt do anything after all, like watching Star Trek and finding out Khan is a nobody, watching harry potter and finding out the whole thing after arriving at the hogwarts was a dream. Please someone tell me theyd like to see any of the aforemention get a good rating with those kinds of stories. 
I will say the graphics (while not high end) were pleasing to look at, and the scene that is created by the game is quite nice, its the kind of game that if i wanted take long walk through the forest, i would play....instead of leaving my house but even then id rather go for the walk. 
All in all: 
6ish? out of 10. better to youtube it for the story than spend the $$ on, unless its like 5$ then maybe,

review: The game delivers a mostly well-paced story. Though it suffers like many narrative games tend to do in holding the story together near the end. It is engaging but relaxed. It is pleasant but somewhat unnerving. The gameplay is shallow, but it makes up for it with atmosphere. However, I cannot give my recommendation for this game. The developer has abused his copyright to promote political aims and that is something that I cannot abide.

review: It's a walking simulator, at too high a price. The story is enjoyable, but it doesn't have branching paths. This game is NOT worth $20, if I had to do it again, I wouldn't pay more than $5. At least, I would have, until the developer's recent DCMA abuse. I couldn't give two hot s***ts about Pewdiepie, but the way they handled the situation was dissapointing, and I can't say that I will purchase any more tiltes from this developer, unless they make amends. Their action could set up very negative trends in the gaming marketplace.

review: This game is utterly boring and is basically a walking simulator.  I'll admit, the game looks great, but that doesn't make up for the fact that the developers are social justice warriors who try to silence anything they deem as "hate speech."  They should be ashamed of themselves.  You'd think that someone in the realm of video games would understand the importance of free speech, but I guess not.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review: This developer has set a dangerous precedent that threatens every streamer and also puts a great deal of stress on other developers. Will someone play our games if they're afraid we'll randomly attack them? Streamers are a huge source of free advertising that's now at a turning point. It's a lot less likely, because of this developer explicitly, that indie games will be used in lets plays. Honestly, the developer owes a lot of people an apology and really needs to enter the adult world. This kind of behavior is not only unprofessional, it's destructive across the board and should be condemned by all. It's little to no consolation that this dev has lost all credibility and is now seen as toxic by other developers, gamers, and streamers. The damage has been done. Vanaman should be ashamed of himself, but with his lack of ethics and unwillingness to consider the repurcussions of his actions, I'm sure he's just fine with all the people he's hurting by pulling this stunt.

review:
False DMCA claim simulator 2017
And yes, this is simply a statement towards the lack of character displayed by the developer, not actually about the game. But by their standards, attacking someone's income based on something that has nothing to do with you is acceptable.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review:
In light of recent news I got reminded that this game existed.
It's not a game you'll remember at all in the future.
If you want a game with below average gameplay.
A game with a pretty average story.
Then go for it.
But just remember you'll be done in 3-4 hours and left pretty dissapointed
at how lackluster the atmosphere was.

review:
This game has a really well-told story (albeit the end is anti-climatic as hell), the voice-actors are amazing and the visuals are beautiful. I really recommend playing it if you like story driven games.
Only issue is that the Dev started filing false DMCA claims against people he doesn't like. And I REALLY don't like the implications of that.

review:
I have mixed feelings about this game. 
It's very atmospheric and fun to look at. The narrative is intriguing too. The world ironically makes me want to go backpacking and live in solice for a time. But then there is something evil lurking underneath the glamor. Degeneracy. 
When I began the game, I got the sense the main character was on a journey to heal himself from the pain of watching his marriage and wife decay due to her dimensia. But then the game insults this idea and the main character by pushing infidelity constantly. But maybe that is the point? 
While many people on the reviews I've seen don't like the conspiracy arc of the story, I was more interested and bothered by the game's push to get the main character to cheat on his sick wife. And in my opinion the conspiracy stuff was a red herring. Fluff to make the game seem more intruging than it really is. The true intent of the game is to see if you would selflishly cheat on your sick wife. Perhaps I pass the games test as the ending I chose was to keep the ring on the finger and keep the marriage intact but it was clear to me that the game really really wanted me to break those vows for your female partner on the radio that you speak to throughout the game. 60% of the dialogue choices leaned towards infidelity. 
This game is also something you wouldn't play more than once. Running is slow and there isn't much else to do after  playing it through once. In my opinion this game would have been much more successful as as movie than a videogame as it's mostly just walking around and looking at stuff. There is no real challenge. 
In conclusion I think this game is pointless. The red herring story is there just to keep you going but is ironically not as interesting as the story leads it up to being while the relationship that builds between the main character and the woman on the radio is designed solely to see if you are cuck enough to cheat on your wife. 
Don't play it. It's not worth $20. Buy a bottle of jack instead and share it with good friends.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review: Story was way too short for the price and the dev is kind of a bully
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review:
The art style of this game is unique but for 20 bucks it is too short and ending is terrible.
 I would of given it higher but the developers also change their policy on streaming to whoever they please and have taken down streams using DMCA claims even though they clearly state on their website anyone can stream the game and even profit from it.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review:
TL;DR Game is interesting just way to short. 3/5
Founder Sean Vanaman is a c*nt and I cannot recommend financially supporting anyone who is such a massive prick. 
The game itself is interesting, though short and ends abruptly.
I have a different reason for not reccomending this game; one of the founders, Sean Vanaman, has decided that its now okay to selectively use copy right take downs on anyone he simply does not like. It's ok for people to use Campo Santo games in lets plays and streams (per their website) except when that person said something you take personal offence too. Pewdiepie said something terrible and people are understandable upset, but to rally the dev community against him to try and gut him from YouTube? Really? Do you really not have anything better to do Sean Vanaman? 
Don't buy this game, founder is a massive dick who thinks its ok to push people around just because they don't agree with his regressive views that ironically help keep racism alive by giving a certain word, and you know which word I'm talking about, power.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review:
I thought it was a fairly decent game. Only if you wanted what you clearly expected from it. A walking simulator. But the issue that I have with this game is with the developer. Sean Vanaman abused the DMCA system and made a copyright strike against PewDiePie's Firewatch video. I'm not trying to defend what PDP said since I think it wasn't right to say what he did, and I am even someone who believes in free speech to the exstent of not caring what others think. But the issue has to do with whats right and whats wrong. You cannot make a video game, literally say it's ok to make money off that said game, then go back on your word because you disagree and take down another persons video. Sean wouldn't have reacted this way if a small time YouTuber said what PDP said, so what makes it right to do it to him? Its terrible. I truly thought the people at Campo Santo had great potential for making games even when people would shoot me down for saying I liked them. Unfortunatly, I can no longer support a game company that abuses a law put in place to protect people like themselves.
In short, at the time of this games release it seemed alright. But since the recent turn of events, I see virtue signaling from a corrupt game company. Firewatch is not worth $20.00 or even the lowest sale price Steam can give it. Do not buy this game.

review: Pretty cool short game, but imo Campo Santo are a pile of sh**bags for filing a DMCA claim against possibly the single largest impact to their sales. No gamer in their right mind think that someone playing a game means that dev's values line up with the gamers.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review: co dev threatened to dmca pewdiepie for no reason other than not liking pewdiepie and i think its honestly BS i would of rated this game a 4 out of 10 as its as others say seems like a half assed game in everything but its certain visual appeal however with the devs behavior of doing this after any coverage about fire watch during its launch but is doing it now is stupid and inmature.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review: Disappointing game. The game is short, and does not give you any choice over anything. Worst of all, the developer has shamed people he dislikes, those who propped his game up despite it being vastly overrated, and even abused his power to file strikes against channels he disagreed with. This is childish, destroys the good will people give to you with their advertisement, and now I feel compelled to give the real review of the game, which said developer never got because I thought to give him a pass for an overrated game because of the positive vibes. Now I realised it is just yet another self important narcissistic person who needs to be given the real talk in the form of proper review. Hope you enjoy that $10 you took from me, it will be the last tenner from me to you.

review:
I have to admit, I really like the game and the style of it.
It's kind of short but for the price, it's ok.
I even followed and watch some of the development processes, and got really into it.
But when the company want to use false DMCA claims to get videos taken down made by someone that said something bad in a diferent video... I can't recommend someone to support such thing like that. 
And clearly, Pewdiepie didn't said that with genuine racism. He was live streaming, and with the heat of the moment, was pissed of and said something bad. I just don't understand why the company needs to show this attitude towards pewdiepie, why all this hate? Really let me down.

review:
It's not a bad """game""" if you can even call it that.
It has a nice story, but it's painfully linear and fails to take advantage of the video game format.
Wouldn't suggest you buy, just watch a let's play.
Also, don't support devs that abuse DMCA takedowns.

review:
This was a waste of 20 dollars. At first the game was pretty decent- it had some good suspenseful parts stuck in. But the middle and ending? Absolutely terrible. I thought it was going to be something really amazing, given all the information, but it all just leads to... a huge fire and then you leave in a helicopter and nothing comes out of the conversation you have with the other person.
I would've gotten my money back, but of course the gameplay lasts /just/ long enough to void the return policy on steam.

review:
POSTED: 9 SEPTEMBER
I"ve been sitting here for a good while now trying to understand how I feel about this game. The narrative and voice acting is spot on. The game graphically is beautiful. The musical score is great. However with the positives I feel that they ran out of ideas or direction. I knew going in it was going to be a short game, but I didn't think this short. That's not even the issue. The game just......ended....Top 3 worst endings of a story rich game I've ever seen. It disappoints you. Breaks your heart and not in a great narative type of way, more like a the developers ran out of content or vision type of heartbreak. If a 2nd game is in the works I'll gladly change my review. But as it stands they took a wonderful idea and gave up 3/4 of the way through it. You just feel longing for closure for it to be finished. So much potential. But Length times price times poor execution closer to the end= no buy for me. Do I regret buying it? No not really. But had I known what I know now I wouldn't have. You're better off watching THE RAD BRAD play it. I would say for the sheer voice acting and wonderful visuals that it may be worth it for that, but only if on a good sale.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review: A game so good, it's developers will censor your free speech like they censored the free will of the main character. Make no mistake, do not attempt to play this game on YouTube, you will only be attacked by the creator after bringing them thousands of sales.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review:
You are better off watching a let's Play of Firewatch as there is no gameplay only scripted dialogue and story.  So save your money and watch it on Youtube.
 BTW: My first review was deleted as have most that are critical of this game and its developer in recent weeks.
I would expect no better of a developer who tries to destroy someone's career because they spoke out of turn than to then seek to censor those that called them out on their awful behaviour and their  ludicrously overrated walking simulator.
I fully expect Campo Santo to have  this review removed as well because they are cowards and censoring criticism is what cowards do best.

review: This game is fucking great, if you hate everything to do with gameplay. As a bonus it at least gave me the drive to finish studying for my aviation exams. Thanks Firewatch
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review: Unfortunately a sight all to common today as a pathetic thin skinned developer wants to drum up controversy and use it to draw attention to their mediocre product. All that aside firewatch is about a three hour walking simulator that I've played once and don't ever intend to play again. It teases you all the way through making you think you're on to this big super important conspiracy event, which without spoiling it turns out to be probably the most stupid and convouluted thing you could imagine. Game in my mind is worth $5.00 no where near it's outragous $19.99 price tag. If you want a good walking simulator there are plenty of other fine ones out there with developers that are much more mature at handeling issues then this.

review:
Before I start I would like to say that the game is good, graphics are nice, storytelling is very immersive and the exploration is really enjoyable. Everything about this game is good except the point that i'm going to make and that makes me put a thumbs down on it.
This game is about the story, it got a moral and point of view wich it slowly leads you to, but it's hollow, it's not beatiful it's an empty shell, and it is this way because of the recent action of the co-creator of the studio developping this game, and since he is talking for the entirety of the studio, Santo Campo.
Santo Campo recently gave a strike to the most famous youtuber not because of copyright abuse but because of point of view about the youtuber's personality.
This action has several consequences :
1) It made them pubicly lied, they said community ( wich includes this youtuber ) could stream and make videos of their game and monetize them making them acting against the stance that this game took.
2) They advocate freedom of speech but actively try to censor a contenant creator because they considerate their point of view more important more true than other's. Making the point of this game seems a lot more... selfish, fake, untrue, hollow...
3) They made a game about trying to get your life back together and actively tries to destroy someone way of earning money and live, someone else's life. Wich goes against the point of this game yet again, wich makes everything i've seen and loved about this game a terrible LIE. I'm so disapointed. I loved the game so much.
I don't want any refund or anything, what I want back is my point of view, and my feeling of joy this game brought to me. But even the bigest update of steam cant refund me that now, can it ?
If you want something true in your life, and if you want the experience that the game brings to you to be real, to mean something, don't buy this game.
Or any other game from this company.
You will just end up being disapointed and depressed by the lack of genuine lessons of life those people could have bring you, but yet because they cant keep on their word, they just can't give that to you.
Their game has nothing for them left.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review: I really wanted to like this game.  The premise and story are ok and I really enjoy adventure games.  However I guess the writers of the script are trying to make a somewhat of boring game more exciting by dropping the F-bomb and other profanities into every dialog.  I mean c'mon!  Seriously you think that the general audience for your game needs to hear the over use of this type of dialog?  Just low class if you ask me.  Instead of focusing so much on the bar-talk, maybe they should have focused on making a more interesting story.  Really bummed that I paid full price, as it is not worth even  1 cent for this trash!  All this game would be good for, is to throw in the Fire!  Not recommended. Guess I paid them to write an honest review, that is if they take the advise of the critical reviews to inprove their next game.  I would welcome a refund!

review: I'm filling a negative review of Sean Vanaman's Firewatch game and any future Campo Santo games.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

Don't buy this game.

review: I'm really torn here, wether or not you should buy this game. I really enjoyed the game, but I wouldn't support someone who misuses DMCA claims.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review: Sub-par quality game from a company that supports censorship. This game should be ****, it is that bad. It is nothing but a poorly written interactive story from the simple mind of Sean Vanaman. This game is a snooze-fest. Don't waste your money.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review:
I deeply regret supporting a company that publically threatens the livelyhood of streamers and gaming videos over personal vendetta. DMCA is not a tool to force your beliefs on others, and Campo Santo took a first step to using it as a weapon against a medium I enjoy on a daily basis, in fact, more than I ever did their game. I fear that this incident will give other companies the courage and boldness to do the same thing. I can only hope that other companies have more integrity than what Campo Santo have showed.
The game itself is a very short but also well crafted walking simulator. Buy it on a sale.

review: This game was pretty much a polished, shiny trash can. We all knew it was a walking simulator going in, but damn. You get 5-6 hours, if you're thorough, of mildly engaging story and holding down W, only to be thrashed by the 'we ran out of money' style ending, as well a light feeling that you've just been robbed. $20 for this game is theft, and overall it's one big pile of disappointment.

review:
No real gameplay (a walking simulator) that's kind of sandbox in the sense you can go anywhere but it really just means you don't know if you're on the proper rails you're supposed to be on so you're just running into walls and constantly checking your map.
I finished this game in 5 hours.  This not worth your money.  Even the people saying this is "pretty" are wrong - the graphics are cartoonish and some things look unfinished.

review:
A lot of reviewers complain about the ending and about the length of the game.
Both of those issues are fair and valid. The game is extremely short, the ending is just disappointing. Despite a very interesting start, good voice acting and great visuals you will be left feeling that you have just wasted your time by the time you finish it, since no of your actions matter at all and the ending is very bland and non-engaging. The closer you get to the end the more disappointed you will be.
TLDR - do not waste time and money on this game, game is a walking simulator and none of your actions matter.
If you want to try to enjoy the story - watch someones "lets play" on youtube, would probably be more entertaing.
This review is in no way related to the developer's controversies with YouTube and PewDiePie, but I was merely reminded to write this because of all the hype surrounding it.

review:
You'll notice most reviewers play this game for 3 to 4 hours... Its because thats literally how long it takes to play through all the content. Its very linear, and would be an OK "walking simulator" if it wasn't so short. 
Not worth $20 at all...
Also, i'm tired of Devs using crappy consumer practices in order to prove to everyone how virtuous they are. Its pathetic, and certainly not Heroic. Dev issued a DMCA takedown notice to try to get a little publicity for his game and virtue signal. I can't get behind such anti-consumer business practices.

review: This game is so simple, how could the devs screw it up so bad? Runs terribly and it is super boring. The game is also poorly written by the simple mind of Sean Vanaman. Swing and a miss buddy, try again. Not to mention this joker and his company support censorship. Never again will I make the mistake of purchasing a game from Campo Santo. Don't waste your money.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review: Copyright strike my negative review. It's just one more DMCA. Anyone that defends this company's actions are misinformed. The game itself is alright and for 10$ or less I think it is a good buy. However supporting a developer that would ruin let's plays is something I cannot in good conscience do. If I could return I would but unfortunately the only thing I can do is try to inform others of the shady practices of this company and urge you to not give them anymore money.

review: You spend 3 hours waiting for something to happen. Unfortunately, nothing ever does.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review:
The game makes itself out to be a survival game that was equipped with amazing voice acting, excellent scenery, and an awesome story line (something most surival games do not have at al!). However, the game in reality is an extremely linear progress based game where the story line itself is the ONLY way to play. Sure, you can spend as much time as you want just running around (Sorry, running back and forth) through the hallway of the map, and listenening to the atmosphereic sounds and noises, but you aren't truly surviving, you are working towards a quest that the plot leads you to believe is some spooky supernatural happeneing, but, (partial spoiler~) its not. 
Overall, this game was NOT worth the money it calls for. Better off going online and spending an hour watching someone do a cinematic play through on youtube. 
Recently they added a 'free roam' option. But, like stated above, the map is basically a giant hallway. There isn't some open world concept or a free range of different pursuable options.
TLDR: the game is one long hallway progression story mode, not worth sinking time into only to come out unsatisfied in the end.

review: A very linear game with very little actual gameplay or game content. Total game time is about 3 hours.   It plays more like if you were just watching a movie and should be worth the same price, a few dollars.  The developer seem to be jumping on the bandwagon of trying to scam gamers into paying game prices for delivering a "visual novel".  This combined with hearing the Developer's recent rants about the gaming community and the over generous game review you can tell that this is another "Lost at home" Developer.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.
text_cleaned: a very linear game with very little actual gameplay or game content. total game time is about 3 hours. it plays more like if you were just watching movie and should be worth the same price, few dollars. the developer seem to be jumping on the bandwagon of trying to scam gamers into paying game prices for delivering visual novel . this combined with hearing the developer recent rants about the gaming community and the over generous game review you can tell that this is another lost at home developer.

review: I wish if i didnt buy this game, even though i got it on sale, i still cant believe that the devoloper could basically be that childish, i feel sorry for the people who worked with him.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

review:
Garbage walking simulator.
 That's it. That's all I really need to say. I could end this review here. But I guess I could go into a bit more detail.
 The game had "something" of an interesting premise at the start. Before actually taking control of the story, you read a series of text excerpts detailing the events leading up to the beginning of the game. However, as soon as we get into the game itself, you instantly become aware of the fact that the game is... well... nothing. Even by the standards of "narrative driven" games, this one just sucks. A clunky, confusing build up, that ultimately leads to a resolution that is simultaneously nonsensical and completely unsatisfying. That's what you're getting when you buy this game.
 There's nothing worse than a bad ending, and boy does this game deliver in that regard.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review:
The purpose of a review is to give people a subjective criticism of the quality of a game and it's worthiness to pay.  Writing a review has an ethical responsibility to the game developers and the potential customers alike in that it should be honest and not misleading; not influenced by any irrelevant opinions the reviewer might have about the developers themselves.
Writing a negative review about a game that you actually enjoyed is akin to using a legal digital millenium copyright claim to take down a lets-play of a game which has brought you a great deal of custom and free advertising because you don't like something a person said.
So yeah, thanks for reading.

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.

review:
There's a saying; "A pile of crap painted gold is still a pile of crap," and if there isn't a saying like that, there should be.
That's Firewatch in a nutshell: a pile of crap hiding behind bright colors, excellent voice work, and a good art style in a desparate attempt to distract from how empty and worthless it is. The characters are flat and unappealing and so lacking in endearing traits that it's almost depressingly easy to say, "I don't care what happens to these people." The soundtrack is bland and forgettable. What little story there is drags on and on to the point that continuing play is a chore. The most interesting moments are the first fifteen and the last ten minutes of play, before the startlingly abrupt ending, with everything in between being a long, drawn-out slog of nothing happening. No conflict, no character development, no interesting plot, no deeper mystery, NOTHING!
Save your money for something actually entertaining. Like porn or Shayamalan's The Village or a bucket of paint to throw on the wall and watch dry.
(EDIT)
No, Steam, I don't care how many diagrams you throw on this page, the game is still sh!t.

review: Firewatch is a game I wanted to like. But ultimately, it is a game whose components did not end up meshing into a good finished product. I enjoyed talking with friends about how the game subverted our expectations, but the game itself was not an experience I can recommend. Your time is better spent elsewhere. If you're looking for this kind of game or experience, there are plenty of games, movies and books that are far more compelling in telling the same kind of story.

review:
This game is pretty much a bargain bin movie you get from walmart. You watch it once, and sometimes it looks good, but the end product is unsatisfying and there is no reason to rewatch it.
Pros:
Semi-good visuals
Some choice in story (which only results in different dialouge)
it gets "spooky"
Cons:
Little to no replayability
Lots of walking
Choices don't change story
Developers bend over for SJWs
Should you buy?
I don't recommend, spend your money on a game with more replay value

Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: Firewatch is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Wyoming wilderness, where your only emotional lifeline is the person on the other end of a handheld radio.

review:
a shallow, forgettable, disappointing game/story that ends rather suddenly, without resolving the story arc. It's like the developers ran out of time on a term paper and just handed in whatever they had up to that point. It made me feel cheated as a participant in this linear story. I doubt that any of the decisions in the game had any impact. It's not worth playing twice to find out.
The beautiful graphics and superb voice acting aren't enough to save it and there are far better ways to spend a few hours than this. In fact, go out and walk around your neighborhood. More satisfying.
Not recommended.

review:
Very pretty game, but also a bit boring after a while. The story is a let down. Not to mention the main character is a dick, and should just go home to his wife instead of flirting with some random firewatcher up in the mountains when his wife is ill. 
Most of the time while playing this I just wanted to scream at the guy to go home to his wife. 
Quite forgettable game, as I don´t remember much except the main character pissing me off after playing only a short while ago.

review:
So didn't really pay much attention to this game when it got launched (watched the TB vid etc) unfortunately while the hypocritical dev wanted all the free publicity from LetsPlays etc even to the extent of putting an explicit permission page on their site, they are clearly morally bankrupt enough to abuse DMCA in order to punish a content creator who has said something to upset them now that his vid is of no benefit to them but they can still try and destroy the career of those who helped promote their wares.
The TL;DR is for anyone planning on doing business with this developer or covering their games in the future is DON'T! - THIS DEVELOPER IS UNTRUSTWORTHY and you cannot believe anything they say so you put your business and revenue at risk if you engage with them .
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
game_description: In Firewatch you play as a man named Henry who has retreated from his messy life to work as a fire lookout in the Wyoming wilderness. Perched high atop a mountain, it’s your job to look for smoke and keep the wilderness safe. An especially hot and dry summer has everyone on edge. Your supervisor, a woman named Delilah, is available to you at all times over a small, handheld radio — and is your only contact with the world you've left behind. But when something strange draws you out of your lookout tower and into the world, you’ll explore a wild and unknown environment, facing questions and making interpersonal choices that can build or destroy the only meaningful relationship you have.

review: Boring. Can't choose black people as playable character. Totally garbage.
review_bomb_reason: Die Entwickler "Campo Santo" reichten eine DMCA-Beschwerde gegen ein Video ein, das der bekannte YouTuber "PewDiePie" zu Firewatch gemacht hatte (d.h. er wurde gezwungen, das Video zu entfernen), nachdem PewDiePie während eines seiner Livestreams eine rassistische Bemerkung geäußert hatte. Viele Spieler gaben daraufhin negative Bewertungen zu Firewatch ab und bezeichneten die Entwickler als "Social Justice Warrior" (SJW), oder behaupteten sie würden Zensur unterstützen.
